page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: Glyncorrwg is a dead-end and the only form of transport is road. There is only one road into the viilage.There is a regular bus service to the towns and a bus leaves the village every hour. There is a limited service on Sundays. This however is due to change with the buses leaving ever two hours and no service on Sundays. There are private services for people travelling to work; the colliers have their own transport and workers in the Borg Warner Plant have their own transport. The N.C.B. supply transport free but the Borg Warner transport is paid for by the workers. The majority of the working population have cars which are necessary for them to go to work.
